009package imagingbook.common.util;
010
011import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
012import java.io.PrintStream;
013
014/**
015 * Classes which require a complex {@code toString()} method should
016 * implement this interface, which requires the single method 
017 * {@link #printToStream(PrintStream)}, e.g.,
018 * <pre>
019 * public void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
020 *     strm.format("...", ...);
021 * }</pre>
022 * Note that this interface cannot override the default {@link Object#toString()} 
023 * method directly. If needed, this should be done in the implementing class by
024 * using the pre-defined {@link #printToString()} method:
025 * <pre>
026 * public String toString() {
027 *    return printToString();
028 * }</pre>
029 * @author WB
030 * @version 2021/09/17
031 */
032public interface PrintsToStream {
033        
034        /**
035         * To be implemented by concrete implementations.
036         * This method is supposed to write a description of this object
037         * to the given {@link PrintStream}.
038         * @param strm the output stream to print to
039         */
040        public void printToStream(PrintStream strm);
041        
042        /**
043         * Utility method to save some boilerplate code.
044         * Returns the description of this object produced
045         * by {@link #printToStream(PrintStream)}.
046         * @return the string representation of this object
047         */
048        public default String printToString() {
049                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
050                try (PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas)) {
051                        printToStream(strm);
052                }
053                return bas.toString();
054        }
055
056}
